NYHA Functional Classification: Class IIV

Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease Criteria: GOLD 14
GOLD 1 mild: FEV1≥ 80% predicted
GOLD 2 moderate: 50% ≤FEV1 <80% predicted
GOLD 3 severe: 30% ≤FEV1 <50% predicted
GOLD 4 very severe: FEV1 <30% predicted
Peripheral arterial disease (PAD) Severity Classification by Fontaine
Stage I: Asymptomatic, incomplete blood vessel obstruction
Stage II: Mild claudication pain in limb
Stage IIA: Claudication at a distance > 200 metres
Stage IIB: Claudication at a distance < 200 metres
Stage III: Rest pain, mostly in the feet
Stage IV: Necrosis and/or gangrene of the limb

Peripheral arterial disease (PAD) Severity Classification by Rutherford
Grade 0 Category 0: Asymptomatic no hemodynamically significant occlusive disease
Grade 0 Category 1: Mild claudication
Grade I Category 2: Moderate claudication
Grade 1 Category 3: Severe claudication
Grade II Category 4: Ischaemic rest pain
Grade III Category 5: Minor tissue loss nonhealing ulcer, focal gangrene with diffuse pedal ischaemia
Grade III Category 6: Major tissue loss extending above transmetatarsal (TM) level, functional foot no longer salvageable
